message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.SE, cs.MM

The paper deals with the security of the HDMI protocol and its Consumer Electronics Control (CEC) protocol, which is used for interaction between devices within an HDMI distribution network. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also involves network security mechanisms, which suggests the category cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also discusses security mechanisms to provide comprehensive security evaluation, which falls under the category cs.SY (Systems and Control). Additionally, the paper involves the implementation of attacks on HDMI devices, which falls under the category cs.SE (Software Engineering). Finally, the paper deals with the Audio/Video interfacing between video-enabled devices, which suggests the category cs.MM (Multimedia).
